description: Decimal expansion of square root of 62.
comments: Sqrt(62) = 787400 * Sum_{n>=0} (A001790(n)/2^A005187(floor(n/2)) * 10^(-6n-5)) where A001790(n) are numerators in expansion of 1/sqrt(1-x) and the denominators in expansion of 1/sqrt(1-x) are 2^A005187(n). 786400 = 62*12700, see A020819 (expansion of 1/sqrt(62)). - _Gerald McGarvey_, Jan 01 2005Continued fraction expansion is 7 followed by {1, 6, 1, 14} repeated. - _Harry J. Smith_, Jun 07 2009
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
prog: (PARI) { default(realprecision, 20080); x=sqrt(62); for (n=1, 20000, d=floor(x); x=(x-d)*10; write("b010515.txt", n, " ", d)); } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Jun 07 2009
crossrefs: Cf. A010146 Continued fraction. - _Harry J. Smith_, Jun 07 2009
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
extensions: Final digits of sequence corrected using the b-file. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 30 2009
